name: Gautam Gupta
about_me: I am a third year student pursuing Economics and Finance. I love playing and watching all sports. My interests vary from travelling solo to tracking the stock markets.
book_review: Value Investing And Behavioral Finance by Parag Parikh

name: Yash Khaitan
about_me: I'm an Economics and Finance major passionate about investing, data analytics, and public policy. I continually seek opportunities to enhance my skills and apply my knowledge to real-world situations.

name: Soumya Choudhary
about_me: Hi, I am Soumya. I’m from Kolkata and a prospective economics and finance major. Besides being an avid reader, I am a constant learner and always keen to know new things.

name: Avi Dhall
about_me: I am an investment analyst with a passion for technology and finance, focusing on manufacturing, logistics, and technology-based companies. I aim to gain deeper insights and craft informed, effective investment strategies using both quantitative and qualitative analysis.

name: Arshia Kohli
about_me: I am Arshia Kohli, a second year student majoring in Economics and Finance at Ashoka University, Sonepat. I am extremely passionate about researching, analysing data using excel and preparing reports. From the past year in college, I’ve been heavily involved in analysing potential investment opportunities.

name: Avi Nalin
about_me: I am a driven and enthusiastic professional with a passion for finance and understanding how successful businesses operate. I love research, whether it is equity analysis, startup evaluation, or exploring business dynamics and financial strategies.

name: Krtya Sunil
about_me: My passion for finance propelled me towards joining the Ashoka Investments Club. The notion of a stock representing a company intrigued me. As a value investor, I spend much of my time diligently researching undervalued stocks, of companies that have a moat that protects its position in the market.
book_review: The Joys of Compounding by Gautam Baid.

name: Saptak Bhattacharya
about_me:
A finance enthusiast at heart, I love the markets, the frenzy. I love how capital has transformed in the 21st century (not to sound like Piketty). I joined AIC, and Bodhi Capital, in my first year and it has been an incredible journey to meet wonderful people to learn more from every day. 

My motto is, everyday try to know 1% more than you did yesterday and someday you might end up knowing more than a room full of people.
book_review: Little Book of Common Sense Investing

name: Nishant Jayade
about_me: Hey, Nishant here. I'm an active stock investor, badminton player, and gym enthusiast. I am passionate about analyzing and working with businesses to drive innovation. I live by one motto - work hard, party harder.

name: Aadya Jeloka
about_me: Hello, I am Aadya. When I'm not analyzing stocks, you'll find me perfecting my Bharatanatyam moves or diving into a good book. Inspired by my father, I aim to understand companies through rigorous fundamental analysis.
book_review: The Joys of Compounding by Gautam Baid

name: Pranjal Misra
about_me: I am an Economics and Finance Major and a Minor in China Studies at Ashoka University. I enjoy analysing the key drivers of industries and the moats of different players. I enjoy learning about differences in business practices across different regions and their effect on competitive advantage.
book_review: The Dhandho Investor by Mohnish Pabrai

name: Aadi Chintawar
about_me: A driven finance professional at Bodhi Capital, I leverage my passion for learning and skills to analyse financial data and craft insightful investment pitches, aiming to make a positive impact within the industry.

name: Krish Sanghvi
about_me: Hi I am Krish a student of the graduating batch of 24-25. I am also a HEC Paris exchange student where I took courses in business and finance. My interests lie in investing and watching tennis
book_review: Value Investing and Behavioural Finance by Parag Parikh

name: Aditya Prakash
about_me: Hey, I'm Aditya, currently studying Economics and Finance with an interest in investing and equity research. Recently I have also started exploring quantitative methods of analysing stock trends to understand market changes. Besides my interest in finance, I'm also a tennis player and a football aficionado.
book_review: Philip Fisher - Common Stocks and Uncommon Profits and Other Writings

name: Soham Dengra
about_me: Hi, I'm Soham! Apart from my passion for finance and investing, I enjoy playing table tennis or geeking out on quirky podcasts. Through my curiosity and dedication I aim to carve a career for myself in finance.
internships: 1. Equirus Securities  2. Capinity Ventures (Upcoming Internship from Mid July)

name: Cara Sukhtankar
about_me: I am a second year Economics and Finance student at Ashoka University. My biggest inspiration is Warren Buffet, a man whose principles should be at the basis of every investors mindset.
book_review: Parag Parikh - value investing and behavioural finance

name: Neel Issrani
about_me: I’m Neel, an economics and finance major. My investment thesis focuses on identifying emerging trends and discovering undervalued picks in the markets. Outside of maximising shareholder value, I love playing football!

name: Kush Modi
about_me: A rising second-year Eco-Fin at Ashoka University, I am deeply enthusiastic about the Indian equity markets and love to research anything interesting, especially the small and mid-cap manufacturing space.I am also an avid reader and a passionate cricket and poker player.

name: Anirudh Krishnan
about_me: Holding a B.Sc (Hons.) in Economics and Finance, my primary interest is in the field of impact investing. In the past, I have worked with Impact Advisory organisations as a Strategy Consulting Intern with the role of understanding and advising corporates on Sustainability Rating Systems both in India and internationally. My work as a Senior Analyst at the Ashoka Consulting Club and Bodhi Capital involved both client projects in the impact education sector as well as researching and developing financial models for public equity securities respectively.

name: Krish Shah
about_me: Passionate about start-ups and the public equity with a sector preference of D2C/consumer, heavy industries and new age tech companies.

name: Arihant Mehta
about_me: I am an eco-fin major. I love playing and watching cricket and reading books

name: Sannidhi Balani
about_me: I am a fourth-year student at Ashoka University majoring in Economics and Finance with a minor in Entrepreneurship. My enthusiasm for the Ashoka investments club is primarily driven by the curiosity of understanding business operations and entrepreneurship. I also particularly enjoy interacting and working with a diverse set of people. Some of my hobbies include working out, dancing and travelling. I also really enjoy watching detective shows in my free time

name: Siddhant Goenka
about_me: I am studying economics and finance at Ashoka University. I love playing sports in my free time. In addition, I love reading.
book_review: Little book of common sense investing

name: Yash Mertia
about_me: I am Yash Mertia, an Economics and Finance student at Ashoka University with extensive experience in consulting and research.
book_review: Value Investing And Behavioral Finance by Parag Parikh

name: Tanya Mehra
about_me: Hi, I'm Tanya, a rising third year at Ashoka University. I am very passionate about finance, with a special interest in investment and technical analysis. Always eager to take on new challenges and collaborate with others to make a positive impact.

name: Krishna Dixit
about_me: I am a rising third-year Economics major at Ashoka, with an interest in equity markets, public finance, and state capacity.

name: Malhar Sanghavi
about_me: I am Malhar Sanghavi, a third year Economics and Finance major, I am deeply interested in analyzing businesses and I try and read as much as I can on companies and then create my own portfolio. I also love cricket and enjoy travelling.
